item.title: EU agrees €90bn loan for Ukraine but without using Russian assets
item.description: Ukraine had wanted the EU to use €200 billion of frozen Russian assets but Belgium opposed the move.

item.title: Brown University shooting suspect found dead, police say
item.description: The suspect ‍in ​last week's ‌mass shooting at Brown University has also been linked by police to the murder of an MIT professor on Monday.

item.title: Japan hikes interest rate to highest level since 1995 as inflation bites
item.description: It comes as new PM Sanae Takaichi is keen for inflation to fall but also needs low government borrowing costs.

item.description: Police said villagers used flaming torches to drive away the elephant, which later died.

item.title: 'He's going off!' - England strike after Australia make review error
item.description: England's Brydon Carse dismisses Jake Weatherald lbw for one, but replays show the decision should have been overturned as Australia are made to regret their decision not to review, leaving the home side on 8-1, with a lead of 93, on day three of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

item.title: TikTok owner signs agreements to avoid US ban
item.description: The deals would end years of efforts by Washington to force ByteDance to sell its US operations.

item.title: How much more your Christmas dinner will cost this year
item.description: A typical turkey dinner will cost about £32.45 this year, according to research done for the BBC.

item.description: One father tells the BBC he owes the life of his child to a stranger forced into an impossible decision.

item.title: Surfers and swimmers pay tribute to victims of Bondi shooting
item.description: Hundreds paddle out at Bondi beach to commemorate the shooting victims from Sunday's attack.
